result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney C Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA and pay surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan with COC Office

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney C Smith

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

2:06 PM Defendant Rodney C Smith in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant wants to accept the offer from the State.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and waives their right to an attorney.  Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently. 

Atty Juech states plea agreement. Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 

Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.

BY THE COURT:  Pay $100 + costs = $579.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge 
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rodney C Smith appeared by phone. 
Court questions as to why the defendant was late coming in the hearing.  Defendant was having troubles with his internet.  
Atty Burdon did send an offer on April 21st.  Defendant received the offer and he would like to accept that offer.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:44 PM Defendant Rodney C Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant is unable to afford an Attorney and he doesn't qualify for Public Defender.  
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and waives their right to an attorney to get an offer from the State. Atty Burdon will get an offer to the defendant..

BY THE COURT:  Set another status
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:14 AM Defendant Rodney C Smith appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.  Bond continued.
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Defendant needs a bit more time to retain counsel.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Set for status.
  Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol

03:15 PM Defendant Rodney C Smith appeared by video means.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond.
Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender.  Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room

BACK ON THE RECORD:
Court signed a PC statement.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.    Court confirms address.

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol  Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
